alert.note: Alert for Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 07 at 6:55AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN HUMBOLDT COUNTY THROUGH 730 AM PST... At 654 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Petrolia, or 17 miles west of Honeydew, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Petrolia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
